be.kdg.sa.services

Class CameraServiceProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.kdg.sa.services.CameraServiceProxy

  • public class CameraServiceProxy
extends java.lang.Object
    Proxy that simulates access to a fictive camera REST service

    This a very thin proxy, it does not return a DTO but plain JSON. Calling get(cameraId) will return the following 

    
    {
      cameraId: int,
      location: {
        lat: double [-90,90],
        long: double [-180, 180]
      },
      segment: {  this element is only present if this camera is the first member of a pair that guards a road segment
         connectedCameraId: int,  id of the second camera on the segment,
         distance: int,  distance between the two camera's in meter,
         speedLimit: int,  speed limit on the segment km/hour
      },
      euroNorm:  minimal norm that applies in the zone (int) (this element is only present if this camera guards a low emission zone)
   }
    This proxy is meant for testing purposes:
    • no real HTTP call is made; the proxy only holds the calling thread for 200 ms to simulate network latency
    • for the moment only camera id's 1 to 5 can be used
    • cameraId's outside this range will return a CameraNotFoundException
    • cameraId 101 will raise an IOException to simulate a communication error

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(int cameraId)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            CameraNotFoundException
        Mimics a get for a single camera resource on a remote HTTP service using the supplied cameraId.
        Parameters:
        cameraId - unique identifier of the camera in the network managed by the service
        Returns:
        a response in the correct JSON format (see class documentation)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a communication/service failure
        CameraNotFoundException - if there is no camera with the supplied id
